intro: Primulina lobulata, commonly known as the velvet leaf. This species is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves that are typically dark green with a prominent midrib. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or white, often clustered in inflorescences. It is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
